$$\begin{align}
\sum_{n=2}^\infty \sum_{k=1}^{n-1} \frac{k}{2^{n+k}} &= \sum_{k=1}^\infty \sum_{n=k+1}^{\infty} \frac{k}{2^{n+k}} \\
&= \sum_{k=1}^\infty \frac{k}{2^k} \sum_{n=k+1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{2^{n}} \\
&= \sum_{k=1}^\infty \frac{k}{2^k} \left( \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{2^{n}} - \sum_{n=1}^{k} \frac{1}{2^n} \right) \\
&= \sum_{k=1}^\infty \frac{k}{2^k} \left( \frac{\frac{1}{2}}{1 - \frac{1}{2}} - (1 - \frac{1}{2^k}) \right) \\
&= \sum_{k=1}^\infty \frac{k}{2^k} \left( 1 - (1 - \frac{1}{2^k}) \right) \\
&= \sum_{k=1}^\infty \frac{k}{2^k} \left( \frac{1}{2^k} \right) \\
&= \sum_{k=1}^\infty \frac{k}{4^k} \\
\text{To solve this series, we can use the following method.}\\
&= \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{k+1}{4^{k+1}} \\
&= \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{k+1}{2^{2k+2}} \\
&= \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{k}{2^{2k+2}} + \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{1}{2^{2k+2}} \\
&= \frac{1}{4} \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{k}{2^{2k}} + \frac{1}{2^2} \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{1}{2^{2k}} \\
\text{Using the method for each of the each sum,}\\
&= \frac{1}{4} \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{k}{2^{2k}} + \frac{1}{2^2} \cdot \frac{\frac{1}{2^0}}{1 - \frac{1}{2^2}} \\
&= \frac{1}{4} \left( \sum_{k=2}^\infty \frac{k}{4^k} \right) + \frac{1}{4} \\
&= \frac{1}{4} \left( \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{k+2}{4^{k+2}} \right) + \frac{1}{4} \\
&= \frac{1}{4} \left( \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{k}{4^{k+2}} + \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{2}{4^{k+2}} \right) + \frac{1}{4} \\
&= \frac{1}{4} \left( \frac{1}{16} \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{k}{4^k} + \frac{1}{2^4} \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{1}{4^k} \right) + \frac{1}{4} \\

&= \sum_{k=1}^\infty \frac{k}{2^k} \left( \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{2^{n}} - \sum_{n=1}^{k} \frac{1}{2^n} \right) \\
&= \sum_{k=1}^\infty \frac{k}{2^k} \left( \frac{\frac{1}{2}}{1 - \frac{1}{2}} - (1 - \frac{1}{2^k}) \right) \\
&= \sum_{k=1}^\infty \frac{k}{2^k} \left( 1 - (1 - \frac{1}{2^k}) \right) \\
&= \sum_{k=1}^\infty \frac{k}{2^k} \left( \frac{1}{2^k} \right) \\
&= \sum_{k=1}^\infty \frac{k}{4^k} \\
\text{To solve this series, we can use the following method.}\\
&= \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{k+1}{4^{k+1}} \\
&= \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{k+1}{2^{2k+2}} \\
&= \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{k}{2^{2k+2}} + \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{1}{2^{2k+2}} \\
&= \frac{1}{4} \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{k}{2^{2k}} + \frac{1}{2^2} \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{1}{2^{2k}} \\
\text{Using the method for each of the each sum,}\\
&= \frac{1}{4} \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{k}{2^{2k}} + \frac{1}{2^2} \cdot \frac{\frac{1}{2^0}}{1 - \frac{1}{2^2}} \\
&= \frac{1}{4} \left( \sum_{k=2}^\infty \frac{k}{4^k} \right) + \frac{1}{4} \\
&= \frac{1}{4} \left( \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{k+2}{4^{k+2}} \right) + \frac{1}{4} \\
&= \frac{1}{4} \left( \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{k}{4^{k+2}} + \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{2}{4^{k+2}} \right) + \frac{1}{4} \\
&= \frac{1}{4} \left( \frac{1}{16} \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{k}{4^k} + \frac{1}{2^4} \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{1}{4^k} \right) + \frac{1}{4} \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \frac{1}{4} \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{k}{2^k} + \frac{1}{2^4} \cdot \frac{\frac{1}{2^0}}{1 - \frac{1}{2^0}} + \frac{1}{4} \\

&= \frac{1}{16} \cdot \frac{1}{4} \cdot \frac{1}{4} \left( \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{k}{4^k} \right) + \frac{1}{16} \cdot \frac{1}{4} \cdot \frac{\frac{1}{2^0}}{1 - \frac{1}{4}} + \frac{1}{4} \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \cdot \frac{1}{4} \cdot \frac{1}{4} \left( \sum_{k=1}^\infty \frac{k}{4^k} \right) + \frac{1}{16} \cdot \frac{1}{4} \cdot \frac{\frac{1}{4^0}}{1 - \frac{1}{4}} + \frac{1}{4} \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \cdot \frac{1}{4} \cdot \frac{1}{4} \left( \frac{1}{4} \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{k}{4^k} + \frac{1}{4^1} \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{1}{4^k} \right) + \frac{1}{16} \cdot \frac{1}{4} \cdot \frac{\frac{1}{4^0}}{1 - \frac{1}{4}} + \frac{1}{4} \\
&= \boxed{\frac{2}{3}} \\
\end{align}$$

The sum is taken over all positive integers $n$ and $k$ such that $k \le n - 1,$ or $n \ge k + 1.$  Thus, we can change the order of summation:
\begin{align*}
\sum_{n=2}^\infty \sum_{k=1}^{n-1} \frac{k}{2^{n+k}} &= \sum_{k = 1}^\infty \sum_{n = k + 1}^\infty \frac{k}{2^{n + k}} \\
&= \sum_{k=1}^\infty \frac{k}{2^k} \sum_{n=k+1}^\infty \frac{1}{2^n} \\
&= \sum_{k = 1}^\infty \frac{k}{2^k} \left( \frac{1}{2^{k + 1}} + \frac{1}{2^{k + 2}} + \dotsb \right) \\
&= \sum_{k = 1}^\infty \frac{k}{2^k} \cdot \frac{1}{2^k} \\
&= \sum_{k=1}^\infty \frac{k}{4^k}.
\end{align*}Let
\[S = \sum_{k = 1}^\infty \frac{k}{4^k} = \frac{1}{4} + \frac{2}{4^2} + \frac{3}{4^3} + \dotsb.\]Then
\[4S = 1 + \frac{2}{4} + \frac{3}{4^2} + \frac{4}{3^3} + \dotsb.\]Subtracting these equations, we get
\[3S = 1 + \frac{1}{4} + \frac{1}{4^2} + \dotsb = \frac{4}{3},\]so $S = \boxed{\frac{4}{9}}.$
